sentences.en: Absolution Add the solution to a mental pain metal pan of cool water.
sentences.cn: 把溶液倒入原来盛有冷水的金属锅里.

sentences.en: And once they are done, they expect absolution.
sentences.cn: 当他们忏悔完, 都期待能得到宽恕.

sentences.en: History does not relate whether the priest gave him absolution.
sentences.cn: 历史并未讲述神父是否赦免了他.

sentences.en: It is the confession, not the priest, that gives us absolution.
sentences.cn: 是忏悔而不是牧师给我们赦免.
教皇列奥赦免了他的罪孽。

sentences.en: She felt as if his words had granted her absolution.
sentences.cn: 她感觉他的那番话好似给她下了道赦令。

sentences.en: The priest heard her confession and granted absolution.
sentences.cn: 神父听了她的告解后给她赦罪.

sentences.en: Those who were penitent obtained absolution.

trans.tran_cn: 宽恕，赦罪，（誓言、诺言或责任的）免除，解除
trans.tran_en: when someone is formally forgiven by the Christian Church or a priest for the things they have done wrong
